name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: 20 million dollars is like one of his kids, it means nothing to him.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Wow, why is SVU wasting its time in New York? You’ve got at least 20 seasons down there in Wisconsin.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: To be fair, if I’m ever talking to a white woman over 50, and I forget her name, I just call her Susan Crawford and I’m usually right like 80 percent of the time.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Maybe Elon just needs glasses. It could change everything. He could be like, Oh my God, that Cybertruck looks like sh*t.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: This scandal won’t be going anywhere any time soon because Mike Waltz has made a key strategic error. Being an idiot everywhere at all times.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: He’s Venmo-ing his doctor? My man, if your doctor takes Venmo, that ain’t a doctor.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: They did an investigation and found that the Trump team’s private data was posted online, including mobile numbers, email addresses, and passwords belonging to Tulsi Gabbard, Pete Hegseth, and Mike ‘Yeah, You Know I’m on This List’ Waltz.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: These are our highest-ranking security officials. I don’t think we should trust these people with anything top secret. Hell, I don’t think we should trust these people with anything Pop Secret.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: In that same White House meeting, not only did the president praise him, Trump assigned Waltz to ‘probe himself.’ Which we all know is a sin, but why limit it to Waltz? As far as I’m concerned, all these people can go probe themselves.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Trump cannot be happy about this. ‘Okay, we’ve lost Don Bacon. This just got real. If we lose Dave Nugget and Mark Filet-O-Fish, I’m a goner.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: What’s worse than ‘the fertilization president.’ Wait—spermander-in-chief.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: ‘A goody bag that helps with fertilization?’ Sir, nobody wants to hear about your scrotum.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: They don’t even need to steal bases this year, they just buy them.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: This is kind of cool. This year, the winning school gets to keep their federal funding.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Even Matt Gaetz was like, ‘How can you be so careless?'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: What a group. We have a national security advisor who doesn’t know how to secure, a defensive Secretary of Defense, a pro-measles Secretary of Health, and a Secretary of Education who wants to close the Department of Education.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Yeah, that’s the problem. They’ve been so transparent, we’ve seen all their information.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: You know how sometimes your friends defend you and you wish they wouldn’t? ‘In the old days when Pete would get hammered and text, everything was spelled wrong, his thoughts were bizarre—this had none of that. There wasn’t even a dick pic!'

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Pete Hegseth and Mike Waltz have said and done so many stupid things this week, Trump might have to start calling them Eric and Don Jr.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Blaming Signal for this is like blaming Tinder when you get caught cheating on your wife.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: It’s not good—right now the White House has a group chat about invading Sesame Street.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Though right now China’s like, ‘Who needs to spy through TikTok when you leak everything in group chats'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: That’s a relief. I mean, he said the same thing about Covid and no problems there.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Meanwhile whenever McDonald’s takes away the McRib, Trump threatens to bomb Scotland.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: He was like, I have to compare them to the documents I have in the bathroom at Mar-a-Lago.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: AHA. It makes sense because under RFK Jr, laughter might be our best and only medicine.
